page.title: 10Local Industry
page.content: The major developments of industries and settlements occurred between 1850 and 1914 - as with many areas of South Wales. Large amounts of in-migration occurred, satisfying labour demands in the new industries. Since World War 2 old industries ( coal mining, stone quarrying, metal making, and metals processing) have declined and even disappeared. There were rapid economic and social changes. Today, various light manufacturing and service industries exist:two steel stockholders occupy large sites at Wattsville; Crosskeys has a National Bus depot. A clay brick works is at Danygraig. The old sheds of Risca North pit are now engineering works. The huge Powell Duffryn quarry at Machen, a major employer, sends stone for crushing and tarmac-making to the Adams quarry, Risca.
